additionalTextInformation.text:
According to D. Koepplin this painting is a copy after a version in the holdings of the Bayerische Staatsgemäldesammlungen now in the Fränkische Galerie, Kronach [DE_BStGS-FGK_1465].

[Letter from D. Koepplin to the owner, 01.09.1989; Koepplin Archive]

pageContext.description:
The subject, the pairing of a foolish old man and a youthful beauty was very popular in sixteenth-century art, affording as it did the opportunity to present a lascivious image under the guise of a morality lesson. This painting depicts a toothless old man holding a young girl in his arms. He is oblivious to the fact that she attempts to steal his purse. The young woman, who is shown looking at the viewer, wears a red dress and precious jewellery. This version is probably an early copy after a version now in the fränkische Galerie, Kronach [DE_BStGS-FGK_1465].
[cda 2020]

restorationSurveys.remarks:
The painting underwent conservation treatment before the end of 1989. [photographs before and after treatment in the Koepplin Archive]
[cda 2020]

tests.text:
Results of samples taken from the paint layers:

Sample 1: 
Site: yellow from the woman's neckband
Pigments: lead tin yellow

Sample 2:
Site: black background
Pigments: soot, small amount of lead white

Identified pigments: lead white, lead tin yellow, pigments containing iron oxide (ochre, umber), vermilion, coloured lakes, azurite, charcoal and bone black as well as soot.
The pigments correspond with the palette employed in the 16th century and suggest that the panel was not produced in the 19th or 20th century.
[Unpublished examination report, H. Kühn, 19.12.1988; Koepplin Archive]

Photocopy of an infrared reflectogram [Koepplin Archive]

- traced or copied lines are clearly visible definining the main contours and describing essential details, but accordling to D. Koepplin are unlike those found on works attributed to Cranach or his workshop

[Letter from D. Koepplin to Herr Konrad, 01.09.1989; Koepplin Archive]

Identification of wood species: cherry tree (Prunus avium L, Rosaceae)

[Unpublished examination report, D.Grosser, 04.01.198; Koepplin Archive]
